div.div: The April Board Meeting will take place on Monday, April 27 and will begin at 7pm. Board Members will be physically present, but the audience is encouraged to participate virtually through our online webinar.

div.div: If your children will be returning for the 2020-2021 school year, you must register them by completing Skyward Returning Student Online Registration.
This article contains resources for students and families to continue their learning and have some fun.
div.a: Read More about Learning Plan / Technology / Questions / Resources

div.div: Our top priority is the safety and well-being of our students and staff. The information in this article is intended to ensure we are prepared and continue to provide the safest environment for our D87 family.
div.a: Read More about School Meals & Closure Information

p.span:
Dear District 87 Community,
It is my privilege to serve as superintendent of schools in District 87. I joined the District 87 family in 2014 and am honored to continue my service to this community. Our District is unique in serving portions of six different villages: Bellwood, Berkeley, Hillside, Melrose Park, Northlake, and Stone Park across six schools: Jefferson Primary, Whittier Primary, Riley Intermediate, Sunnyside Intermediate, MacArthur Middle School, and Northlake Middle School.
We value our diversity, while embracing our common goal of providing the best education to students in grades PreK through 8th. We are one district, that acts as one team, with one mission: help all students achieve!
Our families and community members are valuable members of that team. We know that we are better together as we work to meet the needs of our children. We welcome you all to be active partners in building better schools for a better tomorrow.
As you explore our new and improved website and follow us on social media, please feel free to share your feedback. Communication is key to our progress.
Thank you for trusting District 87 with your children.
Sincerely,
Dr. Terri Bresnahan
One District. One Team. One Mission.

div.p: Berkeley School District 87 does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, age, or disability in admission to its programs, services, or activities, in access to them, in treatment of individuals, or in any aspect of their operations. The lack of English language skills shall not be a barrier to admission or participation in the district's activities and programs. Berkeley School District 87 also does not discriminate in its hiring or employment practices.
